content.content: Simple Summary This is an idea for Expirable NFTs, which extends ERC-721. It is called Expirable Non-Fungible Token (ENFT) to provide potential NFT lending use cases.  Abstract The ERC-721 is mainly used for transferring digital or physical assets and transfer interface does not have any expiration date. Meanwhile, there are some potential possibility of lending NFT such as digital book as NFT which a digital library could lend to person for a certain period. A NFT owner might lend his/her collection to other party momentarily. Or even 1 year real estate rental. With ENFT then when the expiration date is due the NFT temporary ownership will be revoked and the original owner will re-own the digital or physical assets. The ENFT does not consider combining lending condition contract (usually happens in physical world) at this moment but it can be expanded in the future with combine support of lending contract.  Summary The ENFT can be considered as extention of ERC-721 which adding expiration date to support a temporarily ownersip will be expired in future date.
content.GPT-summary: The post proposes the idea of Expirable Non-Fungible Tokens (ENFTs) as an extension of ERC-721 to support temporary ownership of digital or physical assets with an expiration date. The author explains the potential use cases for lending NFTs and mentions the possibility of combining lending condition contracts in the future. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Thanks! Any ideas about if unlock protocol started draft an EIP standard extention about it? I was trying to propose a standard extention if no one is already working on it.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: They did’t write EIP, so feel free to do it.
Have you written an EIP for it? I really support this Idea. We can work on it together if you want.
This has been resolved in EIP-4907: Rental NFT, ERC-721 User And Expires Extension. It has expiration added into it.
Thanks for the information. I appreciate it.
